title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Specifications
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Specifications 
for Petrol, Diesel Fuels and Gas Oils intended for use by non-road mobile 
machinery including inland waterway vessels, agricultural and forestry tractors, 
and recreational craft) Regulations 2025. 

Entry into Force
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (specifications petrol diesel fuel gas oil intended use non-road mobile machinery including inland waterway vessel agricultural forestry tractor recreational craft) regulation 2025 entry force

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 2. These Regulations shall come into effect on 21 May 2025.
text_raw:
2. These Regulations shall come into effect on 21 May 2025. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 2 regulation shall come effect 21 may 2025 interpretation

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 3. (1) In these Regulations—
text_raw:
3. (1) In these Regulations— 

“authorised person” means a person or class of persons appointed in writing by 
a local authority or the Minister to be an authorised person for the purposes of 
these Regulations or an officer of the Revenue Commissioners; 

“Annex I to Directive 98/70/EC² as amended” means Annex I of Directive 
98/70/EC² of the European Parliament and of the Council of 13 October 1998 as 
amended by Commission Directive 2000/71/EC3 of 7 November 2000; Directive 
2003/17/EC4 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 3 March 2003; 
Regulation (EC) No. 1882/20035 of the European Parliament and of the Council 
of 29 September 2003; Directive 2009/30/EC6 of the European Parliament and 
of the Council of 23 April 2009, Commission Directive 2011/63/EU7 of 1 June, 
2011; Commission Directive 2014/77EU8 of 10 June 2014; Directive

2 OJ L350, 28.12.1998, p58-68

4 OJ L076, 22.03.2003, p10-19 
5 OJ L284, 31.10.2003, p1-53

"Iris Oifigiúil" of 18th April, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [136] 3 

2015/15139 of the European Parliament and of the Council of the 9 September 
2015; Regulation (EU) 2018/199910 of the European Parliament and of the 
Council of the 11 December 2018 and Directive (EU) 2023/2413¹ of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 18 October 2023. 

 “Annex II to Directive 98/70/EC² as amended” means Annex II of Directive 
98/70/EC² of the European Parliament and of the Council of 13 October 1998 as 
amended by Commission Directive 2000/71/EC³ of 7 November 2000; Directive 
2003/17/EC⁴ of the European Parliament and of the Council of 3 March 2003; 
Regulation (EC) No. 1882/2003⁵ of the European Parliament and of the Council 
of 29 September 2003; Directive 2009/30/EC⁶ of the European Parliament and 
of the Council of 23 April 2009, Commission Directive 2011/63/EU⁷ of 1 June, 
2011, Commission Directive 2014/77EU⁸ of 10 June 2014; Directive 2015/1513⁹ 
of the European Parliament and of the Council of the 9 September 2015; 
Regulation (EU) 2018/1999¹º of the European Parliament and of the Council of 
the 11 December 2018 and Directive (EU) 2023/2413¹ of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 18 October 2023. 

“Directive 98/70/EC as amended” means Directive 98/70/EC² of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 13 October 1998 as amended by Commission 
Directive 2000/71/EC³ of 7 November 2000; Directive 2003/17/EC⁴ of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 3 March 2003; Regulation (EC) No. 
1882/2003⁵ of the European Parliament and of the Council of 29 September 
2003; Directive 2009/30/EC⁶ of the European Parliament and of the Council of 
23 April 2009, Commission Directive 2011/63/EU⁷ of 1 June, 2011; 
Commission Directive 2014/77EU⁸ of 10 June 2014 and Directive 2015/1513⁹ 
of the European Parliament and of the Council of the 9 September 2015; 
Regulation (EU) 2018/1999¹º of the European Parliament and of the Council of 
the 11 December 2018 and Directive (EU) 2023/2413 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 18 October 2023. 

“Directive 2009/30/EC⁶” means Directive 2009/30/EC⁶ of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 23 April 2009 amending Directive 98/70/EC² 
as regards the specification of petrol, diesel and gas-oil and introducing a 
mechanism to monitor and reduce greenhouse gas emissions and amending 
Council Directive 1999/32/EC11 as regards the specification of fuel used by 
inland waterway vessels and repealing Directive 93/12/EEC; 

“distributing” means the distribution of petrol or diesel fuels for consumption in 
road transport or the distribution of gas oils intended for use by non-road mobile 
machinery (including inland waterway vessels when not at sea), agricultural and 
forestry tractors, and recreational craft (when not at sea) from the point of first 
production in the State or first importation into the State; 

“market” means to distribute to or sell by wholesale or retail at a service station 
petrol or diesel fuels or to distribute to or sell by wholesale or retail at any 
premises gas oils for use by non-road mobile machinery, (including inland 
waterway vessels), agricultural and forestry tractors, and recreational craft; 

9 OJ L239, 15.9.2015, p1 
10 OJ L328, 21.12.2018, p1 
11 OJ L121, 11.5.1999, p13-18 

 
 4 [136] 

“service station” means any premises used, or intended to be used, for the sale 
of petrol or diesel fuel to the public; 

(2) In these Regulations— 

(a) 

any reference to an Annex which is not otherwise identified is a 
reference to an Annex to Directive 98/70/EC² as amended, 
including any footnotes or other requirements specified therein, 
and, for the avoidance of doubt, includes amendments to the 
Annexes adopted in accordance with the procedures specified in 
Article 10 of Directive 98/70/EC² as amended; and 

(b) 

a letter, word, phrase or symbol which has been assigned a 
meaning by Directive 98/70/EC² as amended or is used in 
Directive 98/70/EC² as amended, has that meaning where the 
context requires except where otherwise indicated. 

Scope

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: These regulations set, in respect of road vehicles, and non-road mobile
text_raw:
4. 

These regulations set, in respect of road vehicles, and non-road mobile 
machinery, including inland waterway vessels when not at sea, agricultural and forestry 
tractors, and recreational craft when not at sea, technical specifications on health and 
environmental grounds for fuels to be used with positive ignition and compressionignition engines, taking account of the technical requirements of those engines. 

Environmental Specifications for Petrol
text_norm: 4 regulation set respect road vehicle non-road mobile machinery including inland waterway vessel sea agricultural forestry tractor recreational craft sea technical specification health environmental ground fuel used positive ignition compressionignition engine taking account technical requirement engine environmental specification petrol

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 5. (1) A person shall not market petrol in the State unless it complies with
text_raw:
5. (1) A person shall not market petrol in the State unless it complies with 
the environmental specifications set out in Article 3 and in Annex I to Directive 
98/70/EC as amended. 

(2) A person shall not sell or market leaded petrol within the state. 

(3) Persons or companies distributing petrol in the State shall ensure the 
provision of appropriate information to consumers concerning the biofuel 
content of petrol and, in particular, on the appropriate use of different blends of 
petrol. 

(4) Notwithstanding the generality of paragraph (2) suppliers of petrol may 
market small quantities of leaded petrol with a lead content not exceeding 0,15 
g/l, to a maximum of 0.03% of total sales, to be used by old vehicles of a 
characteristic nature and to be distributed through special interest groups. 

Environmental Specifications for Diesel Fuels
text_norm: 5 (1) person shall market petrol state unless complies environmental specification set article 3 annex directive 98 70 ec amended (2) person shall sell market leaded petrol within state (3) person company distributing petrol state shall ensure provision appropriate information consumer concerning biofuel content petrol particular appropriate use different blend petrol (4) notwithstanding generality paragraph (2) supplier petrol may market small quantity leaded petrol lead content exceeding 0 15 g l maximum 0.03 total sale used old vehicle characteristic nature distributed special interest group environmental specification diesel fuel

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 6. (1) (a) A person shall not market diesel fuel in the State unless it
text_raw:
6. (1) (a) A person shall not market diesel fuel in the State unless it 
complies with the environmental specifications set out in Article 
4 and in Annex II to Directive 98/70/EC² as amended 

(b) Suppliers shall ensure the placing on the market of diesel with a 

fatty acid methyl ester (FAME) content of up to 7%. 

 
 
 
 [136] 5 

(2) Persons or companies distributing diesel fuels in the State shall ensure 
the provision of appropriate information to consumers concerning the biofuel, in 
particular the fatty acid methyl ester, content of diesel fuels. 

Environmental Specifications for Gas Oils
text_norm: 6 (1) (a) person shall market diesel fuel state unless complies environmental specification set article 4 annex ii directive 98 70 ec2 amended (b) supplier shall ensure placing market diesel fatty acid methyl ester (fame) content 7  136 5 (2) person company distributing diesel fuel state shall ensure provision appropriate information consumer concerning biofuel particular fatty acid methyl ester content diesel fuel environmental specification gas oil

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 7. (1) A person shall not market in the State gas oils intended for use by nonroad mobile machinery (including inland waterway vessels), agricultural and
text_raw:
7. (1) A person shall not market in the State gas oils intended for use by nonroad mobile machinery (including inland waterway vessels), agricultural and 
forestry tractors, and recreational craft, the sulphur content of which exceeds 10 
mg/kg. 

(2) Notwithstanding Regulation 7(1), gas oils intended for use by non-road 
mobile machinery (including inland waterway vessels), agricultural and forestry 
tractors, and recreational craft are permitted to have a sulphur content of up to a 
maximum of 20 mg/kg at the final point of distribution to end users to 
accommodate minor contamination in the supply chain. 

(3) Liquid fuels other than those gas oils referred to in paragraph (1) may be 
used in inland waterway vessels and recreational craft only if the sulphur content 
of those liquid fuels does not exceed the maximum permissible content of those 
gas oils. 

(4) This Regulation does not apply to inland waterway vessels when at sea 

or recreational craft when at sea. 

Free Circulation of Fuels
text_norm: 7 (1) person shall market state gas oil intended use nonroad mobile machinery (including inland waterway vessels) agricultural forestry tractor recreational craft sulphur content exceeds 10 mg kg (2) notwithstanding regulation 7(1) gas oil intended use non-road mobile machinery (including inland waterway vessels) agricultural forestry tractor recreational craft permitted sulphur content maximum 20 mg kg final point distribution end user accommodate minor contamination supply chain (3) liquid fuel gas oil referred paragraph (1) may used inland waterway vessel recreational craft sulphur content liquid fuel exceed maximum permissible content gas oil (4) regulation apply inland waterway vessel sea recreational craft sea free circulation fuel

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 8. A person shall not be prohibited, restricted or prevented from placing on
text_raw:
8. A person shall not be prohibited, restricted or prevented from placing on 
the market in the State petrol, diesel fuels or gas oils which comply with the 
requirements of these Regulations. 

Change in Supply of Crude Oils
text_norm: 8 person shall prohibited restricted prevented placing market state petrol diesel fuel gas oil comply requirement regulation change supply crude oil

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 9. Any application by the Minister pursuant to Article 7 of the Directive
text_raw:
9. Any application by the Minister pursuant to Article 7 of the Directive 
and the decision of the Commission in respect of said application shall be 
published online on the Department’s webpage as soon as is reasonably 
practicable after the making of said decision. 

Monitoring Compliance and Reporting –
text_norm: 9 application minister pursuant article 7 directive decision commission respect said application shall published online department webpage soon reasonably practicable making said decision monitoring compliance reporting -

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 10. (1) Compliance with the requirements of Regulation 5 and 6 in respect
text_raw:
10. (1) Compliance with the requirements of Regulation 5 and 6 in respect 
of petrol and diesel fuels, shall be on the basis of the analytical methods referred 
to in Annex I and II to the Directive respectively. 

(2) The fuel quality monitoring system in place shall be in accordance with 

requirements of the relevant European standard. 

(3) Each year by 31 August the Minister shall submit a report on national 
fuel quality data for the preceding calendar year in accordance with the common 
format for the submission established by the Commission by means of an 
implementing act adopted in accordance with the examination procedure 
referred to in Article 11(3) of the Directive. 

 
 
 
 
 6 [136] 

(4) The report prepared in accordance with paragraph (3) shall report on 

(a) 

the total volumes of petrol and diesel fuels marketed with a 
maximum sulphur content of 10 mg/kg; and 

(b) on the availability of, on an appropriately balanced geographical 
basis, of the petrol and diesel fuels with a maximum sulphur 
content of 10mg/kg that are marketed within the State. 

(5) An authorised person may take, at any place in the State, a sample of 

petrol, diesel fuels or gas oils for the purposes of these Regulations. 

(6) The authorised person taking a sample shall— 

(a) 

notify forthwith an appropriate person that a sample is so taken; 

and 

(b) 

if so required by the appropriate person at the time of the giving 
of the notification, divide the sample into two parts, seal and mark 
each part and leave one part with the appropriate person. 

(7) In this Regulation “appropriate person” means the owner of, or any 
person who appears for the time being in charge of, the premises at which the 
sample is taken. 

Metallic Additives in Fuel

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 11. (1) A person shall not market fuel with a methylcyclopentadienyl
text_raw:
11. (1) A person shall not market fuel with a methylcyclopentadienyl 
manganese tricarbonyl (MMT) content that exceeds 2 mg of manganese per litre. 

(2) A label which designates the metallic content of fuel shall be displayed 
at any point where fuel containing metallic additives is made available to 
consumers. 

(a) The label shall— 

(i) 

contain the following text “Contains metallic additives”; 

(ii) be attached to the place where information indicating the 
type of fuel is displayed, in a clearly visible position; 

(iii) be of a size and font that is clearly visible and easily legible. 

Offences
text_norm: 11 (1) person shall market fuel methylcyclopentadienyl manganese tricarbonyl (mmt) content exceeds 2 mg manganese per litre (2) label designates metallic content fuel shall displayed point fuel containing metallic additive made available consumer (a) label shall-- (i) contain following text contains metallic additive (ii) attached place information indicating type fuel displayed clearly visible position (iii) size font clearly visible easily legible offence

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 12. Any person who contravenes any provision of these Regulations shall be
text_raw:
12. Any person who contravenes any provision of these Regulations shall be 

guilty of an offence. 

Offences by bodies corporate
text_norm: 12 person contravenes provision regulation shall guilty offence offence body corporate

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 13. (1) Where an offence under these Regulations has been committed by a
text_raw:
13. (1) Where an offence under these Regulations has been committed by a 
body corporate and is proved to have been committed with the consent or 
connivance of or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of a person being a 
director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate, or a 
person who was purporting to act in any such capacity, that person as well as the 

 
 
 
 [136] 7 

body corporate shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to be proceeded 
against and punished as if he or she were guilty of the first-mentioned offence. 

(2) Where the affairs of a body corporate are managed by its members, 
paragraph (1) shall apply in relation to the acts and defaults of a member in 
connection with his or her functions of management as if he or she were a 
director of the body corporate. 

Prosecutions

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 14. A prosecution for a summary offence under these Regulations may be
text_raw:
14. A prosecution for a summary offence under these Regulations may be 

taken by an authorised person. 

Penalties
text_norm: 14 prosecution summary offence regulation may taken authorised person penalty

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 15. A person guilty of an offence under these Regulations is liable on
text_raw:
15. A person guilty of an offence under these Regulations is liable on 
summary conviction to a Class A fine or imprisonment for a term not exceeding 
3 months or both. 

Revocation
text_norm: 15 person guilty offence regulation liable summary conviction class fine imprisonment term exceeding 3 month both revocation

title: Communities Act, 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations transpose Directive EU 2023/2413¹ of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 18 October 2023 amending Directive 
98/70/EC² as regards the specification of petrol, diesel and gas-oil. 

This Regulation repeals and replaces the European Communities Act, 1972 
(Environmental Specifications for Petrol, Diesel Fuels and Gas Oils for use be 
non-road mobile machinery, including inland waterway vessels, agricultural and 
forestry tractors and recreational craft) Regulations 2011 (as amended).
